abstract: General Electric’s second-quarter results reflected continuing struggles at GE Capital, but analysts said the overall earnings signaled that G.E. was stabilizing its business.
snippet: General Electric’s second-quarter results reflected continuing struggles at GE Capital, but analysts said the overall earnings signaled that G.E. was stabilizing its business.
lead_paragraph: General Electric reported a steep fall in second-quarter earnings on Friday, weighed down by the continuing struggles of its big finance business, falling orders for industrial equipment and declining advertising spending at its NBC television network and local stations.

headline.main: G.E.’s Earnings Fall 47%, Led by Finance Unit
headline.print_headline: G.E.’s Earnings Fall 47%, Led by Finance Unit

abstract: General Electric said Friday that its second-quarter earnings tumbled 49 percent on the continued woes of its finance unit and ongoing weakness in its big industrial units due to the recession.
snippet: General Electric said Friday that its second-quarter earnings tumbled 49 percent on the continued woes of its finance unit and ongoing weakness in its big industrial units due to the recession.
lead_paragraph: General Electric said Friday that its second-quarter earnings tumbled 49 percent on the continued woes of its finance unit and ongoing weakness in its big industrial units due to the recession.

headline.main: G.E. Reports a 17% Decline in Revenue
